content: Which American artist is best known for his drip painting technique and is considered a major figure in the abstract expressionist movement?

The American artist you're referring to is Jackson Pollock. He gained widespread recognition for his unique drip painting technique, which involved dripping and splattering paint onto canvas laid on the floor. Pollock's approach revolutionized the way art was created and perceived, making him a central figure in the abstract expressionist movement of the mid-20th century. His works, such as "No. 5, 1948" and "Convergence," are iconic examples of this style and have had a profound influence on modern and contemporary art.
